definition: "house on a cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 53), occurring in 店, 序, 底 etc
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
Rotterdam, port city in the Netherlands

young deer antler prior to ossification (used in TCM)

to whom the deer falls (idiom); the one to emerge victor (i.e. to seize the empire)/prize winner/champion

sentences.english: The deer was beguiled into a trap.
When Larkshimi tried to killed the chital, she has to avoid the sharp buckhorn which will be very dangerous to the tiger.
sentences.chinese: 当老虎试图咬死白斑鹿的时候，就要避开锋利的鹿角。

sentences.english: His head was kind of pinched on top like a deer's, and he had beady eyes like a rat.
sentences.chinese: 他的头顶很尖，像鹿一样还有像鼠一样的豆子眼。

sentences.english: The gardener told the king about the wind-deer.
sentences.chinese: 园丁把风鹿的事告诉了国王。

sentences.english: The deer's neck to long, total high but its head.
sentences.chinese: 鹿的脖子再长，总高不过它的脑袋。

sentences.english: These deer are borne in China.
The deer fell a prey to the lion.
The park had fine trees, and there were deer roaming among them.
sentences.chinese: 猎苑里树木优良，鹿漫游于树间。

sentences.english: It is, however, to border on vulgarity to make such realistic designs as fish, deer, lotus or crane.
sentences.chinese: 几乎粗鲁的制作如鱼，鹿，荷花或鹤的图案。

sentences.english: Could it have been the deer hunter who let the deer get close enough to bite him?
sentences.chinese: 会不会是那个猎鹿人一直等着那只鹿走过来咬他？

sentences.english: The horns of some deer begin to shed.
The deer dined on dough, though the doe dined on dates.
sentences.chinese: 鹿没有吃生面团，尽管母鹿吃了枣椰子。

sentences.english: There are the deer outside the palings," went on the Banyan deer.
sentences.chinese: 还有那在围篱之外的鹿。

sentences.english: Then Zhao Gao turned to other officials and asked them whether it was a horse.
sentences.chinese: 赵高转身问其他官员这是马还是鹿。

sentences.english: There are bragging rights in the bed of that truck — and there's venison.
sentences.chinese: 车上的鹿让她们有了夸耀的权利。

definition: Père David's deer (Elaphurus davidianus), species of deer native to China that is critically endangered
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
